lookText.lookText: That's Alfr, the village Skald. He's great at any instrument. Though I've heard his singing voice is awful.

text.say: Nice to see you in a good mood, Skald.
What can i say?
It's a lovely day.
The sun's not even up yet, Alfr.
But the light shines through.
Of course it does.
Hey Alfr!

option.choice_text: What more things about Adal have you embellished?

text.say: What more things about Adal have you embellished?
A wizard never reveals his tricks.
You're not a wizard though...
But i tell magical tales, do I not?
You're not going to tell me, are you?
No I am not.

option.choice_text: Have you seen Adal's map around here?

text.say: Have you seen Adal's map around here?
Why would Adal need a map?
I've sang songs of his deeds.
How he leap Bjorn Ironside's gap,
and dueled in the razing of Leeds.
How he ravished the East with his vassals,
and defeated the Sumi up high.
How he burned down lot of Karl's castles.
And broke free from the "Snake-in-the-eye".
Hold on. "Snake-in-the-eye"?
The king of Sjaelland?
Erm... yes
But Adal never broke free.
He's still an underling house of Knytling.
All good tales deserve a bit of embellishment, don't you think?

option.choice_text: ...do you know any good ways of waking people up?

text.say: ...do you know any good ways of waking people up?
Play a tune, sing a song.
They will dance all day long!
Even a massive shieldmaiden?
Oh. We're talking about Brynja here.
In that case...
...you'll need one hell of a large instrument.
Though I left all my horns back in the village...
I know!
Take my flute.
It's the closest you'll get to that sort of a sound.
Right. Well, thank you, Alfr.
I'll return it once I'm done.
No need.
I've heard you play before.
And, well...
You need the practice.
So... how you holding up?
Just thinking of the whole, "Go kill a bunch of Anglians" thing.
Perfectly so.
I mean...
I'm just the Skald.
I'm here for moral support more than anything else.
I'll talk to you later.
